caption: Beautiful park we stumbled across.  Not far from the touristy areas of Paris sits this beautiful park.  Large atriums of plants and trees you can walk through, plentiful space, benches, waterfall.  They also have a small restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating in the middle of the park.  Perfect place to relax.  A balloon ride is also offered here. Public toilets available.

Visiting Parc AndrÃ© CitroÃ«n in Paris is a treat for anyone looking to explore modern design with a touch of history. Built on the former site of AndrÃ© CitroÃ«nâ€™s car factory, this huge 14-hectare park mixes bold, geometric designs with relaxing garden spaces, offering both a sense of grandeur and quiet corners to unwind.  The parkâ€™s main feature is its central lawn, bordered by greenhouses and themed gardens like Jardin Blanc and Jardin Noir. Though only accessible part of the year, the lawn and surrounding greenery are a great spot to relax or play. The parkâ€™s design is intriguing, with greenhouses displaying Mediterranean and exotic plants, and walkways that take you above the gardens, offering a new perspective. The Grand Canal, cascading fountains, and views over the Seine make it a peaceful escape where you can recharge away from city noise.  For families, the interactive fountain court and Ballon de Paris provide unforgettable experiences. The balloon ride offers a fantastic aerial view of Paris, making it a real highlight! Entry to the park is free, though certain experiences, like the balloon ride, come with a small fee.  There is a cafe-restaurant with outdoor seating where visitors can grab snacks or meals, and the childrenâ€™s play area with dancing fountains keeps kids busy and happy. Ping pong and chess tables add extra fun for enthusiasts, while the beautiful views over the Seine make it an ideal spot for everyone. Facilities like toilets and drinking water fountains make the visit more convenient.  One downside, however, is the lack of a clear map, which can make it tricky to discover all the hidden gems in this large park. Although accessible for those with reduced mobility and families with pushchairs, better signage would make it even more enjoyable. Nearby underground parking and public transport options help make the park easy to reach, welcoming both locals and tourists.  While some areas show signs of wear, Parc AndrÃ© CitroÃ«n remains a vibrant mix of history, design, and fun, set against the stunning backdrop of the Seine.
Well maintained public park in the middle of the city.  And they have public toilets. And that's very important to know.
A good Parc;Enough space for families,Couples,Elderly,Singles. Air balloons,Water,Public toilet

Betwween the high rise buldings of Paris, there is a hidden gem of a park, full of different foliage and animals. The might reaver Senna flows nearby and fills the streams with water, in which the ducks frolick all year round! And, you wont believe... there is a sparkling water fountain!! For free!!! You can buy some wiine in the nearby store and make yourself a delicious spritzer mix!! Recommend!!
Took the hot air balloon at Parc Andre Citroen. Great experience!

Nice and calm Park, at the beginning of the park there is a nice restaurant, the balloon activity which gives another option  to see the city from above. From the top, The view is nice and possible to see the top part of the Eiffel Tower The balloon is part of the park and it closes at 18:00 (all the parks in PARIS are closed off at this time) the balloon stays up and lighting till 20:00. After the lights are turned off the balloon is parked on the ground.
Great experience if you are into Nature

Beautiful park right in the middle of Paris, view close up of the Eiffel tower . We'll worth a visit, lots of greenery, esplanade and lawn. Picnic possible ðŸ˜„ Happened to be here also for the 2024 Korean street festival 22 and 23rd June. Food stalls, korean beauty products, clothes,  dance and concert . Worth coming ðŸ¥° â€¦

Overall the best and peaceful place to spend a day or few hours,You can enjoy the Flying Baloon ride to enjoy and capture the beautiful view of Paris city.Best place for day picnic. Baloon only fly in good weather conditions so check online before visiting.

This park is an excellent place to be whether alone, with friends, family or for a romantic rendezvous! Everything you need to have a pleasant time is available.... different playing areas for kids of all ages, canals, water fountain, sports area, lovely green grass to sit and sunbathe, read or have a picnic. There are enough benches to sit and admire the natural beauty of trees, flowers and birds that make the park come alive! For those who enjoy doing sports such as jogging, long walks, it's an ideal location. There are areas where one can observe the different species of flowers and trees and birds. There are toilets, drinking fountains available and the park is well maintained. This is a favourite spot for locals and tourists alike - while walking through, one can hear languages from all over the world - English, Chinese, Japanese, German and French of course....ðŸ˜‰
The most beautiful parc in paris .

Just a giant Park with nice little gardens while you walk through it... There is a big balloon so you can ride it to the top and see the area around you, for your next adventure. There is a river that parks riverboat hotels at as well.

We came across this beautiful park while walking near Seine river in Paris, France. We also soon the Generali hot air balloon taking flight. Lots of flowers, greenery and relaxing sounds of birds chirping.
Lovely park, but the real attraction is the balloon ride, make sure to come early and avoid long lineups.
Super nice park, with lots of little hidden areas to lay down and chill. There are lots of flowers, bamboos, trees. It's just a very nice place.

The unique 'sunken' gardens created by different architects to the right of the park (if standing at the botanical buildings looking towards the park). They're designed based on a feeling, a day of the week a metal and a state of water - google to learn more.

Big, modern design park to have a walk at. It combines many different areas with very interesting design, plants and architectural solutions. Also you can find here memorial for fallen French soldiers participating in military missions. It is worth to visit it if you are in this part of the city.

Perfect for picnics or such tanning. Very modern and beautiful park. Big flat grass area is great, but be sure to walk in the area just next to it as well, just behind the wall of shrubs. There is a big water fountain with sparkling and flat water, some Asian style gardens, picnic table things, bamboo, and cool tucked away spots.
Parc itself is nothing special. But the balloon ride is so worth it. A lot of fun for a very fair and cheap price. Best option to take panoramic pictures.

Beautiful, modern Park. There is a big balloon that can take you up 150m up in the sky. Make sure you check the weather beforehand if you want to get on it because sometimes it's closed off in case of extreme weather conditions (mostly wind).  There are bathrooms that you can use. There are also water spigots all over the park if you want drinking water. There is a huge greenhouse, a small chemin for walking with trees on both sides and play area for kids and adults. During the summer, they turn on water fountains for you to cool off. Love this park!

Before boarding the weather balloon, do wear hand gloves and proper winter clothing, as it gets cold up there.  We had to wait an hour for booking the ticket because they need to first check the weather and safety condition before flying the balloon.  There is also a public toilet inside the park, not well maintained though.

One of the least known parks among the mass, itâ€™s a hidden gem. The most innovative park I have ever seen in Paris, it was inspired by Japanese architecture! The park is quite modern but at the same time, very poetic and quiet.
Awesome place to lay down on the garden if you are not taking the ride. It's tranquil and it's not crowded too. The ride need to wait for 1.5 hours to 2 though. Other than that, it's worth a try

Very bigggggg park. Its the way to reach ballon de Paris generali.. i have crossed nearly three view points to reach the park. There are three different names for the park..i don't know if I am wrong.. but its very big and nice with beautiful scenery around the park..everyone try once to visit..

Nice park in Paris 15. It is located just beside Sein river. If you are nearby it is worth visiting but if you want to spend time to get to a park you will be definitely disappointed! There is 2 major attraction in the park, baloon and jet fountains for children especially in hot days in summer for kids. There is no Resturant or cafe in the park but you can find some outside the park.

It was a nice park where I used to come to have a picnic and read a book. Not anymore. Now itâ€™s infested with rats for several years. Their number increase each month. I donâ€™t think Mairie de Paris does anything. Shame. There were house cats who were coming here to socialize and to hunt. They donâ€™t come anymore, maybe they are afraid?
Nice place. But expensive if you want to eat. Ok, it's Paris, is on banks of Seine, but 13 Euro a pizza and 4.5 Euro a glass with limonade which is not, is bottled Sprite or 7Up it is too far for me
Beautiful park by the Seine river to relax, having a picnic or taking the Generali balloon to have a nice view over Paris

Great park for picnic, relaxing, walking and running. There is an aerostatics globe that goes up and down in the park providing a majestic view of the city. There are short paths that lead to small areas where you feel isolated from the city and pretend to be in a forest. Be sure to explore the different gardens with their diverse collection of plants (fruits, medicinal, etc.) and to take the elevated walk at the level of the tree tops. It's a great place to come with kids or for a romantic afternoon in the park.
A very beautiful park to enjoy shadows from trees and admire the flowers. In the park there is a Ballon which can take you high to admire the panorama of Paris.
It was a great find. Food was delicious and staff very helpful as we could only speak a few phrases in French. Definitely recommend
The park itself is serene and beautiful. Good place to enjoy the sun in winter. There are ducks too so thats a plus!
Ok park, with nice fountains and some plants. There is also a balloon that probably gives a nice view of Paris if you go up. Has a very good, but expensive cafÃ©. Toilets are limited and not clean.
Beautiful parc. Very unusual and modern. Visited in March but still beautiful then.
Great park, nice public clean bathrooms.Go for a hot air balloon Ride with a great view of Paris.
Beautiful park, it'swell designed and one can relax there. It has drinkable water, and also sparkling water!
Perfect place to admire Paris and the Eiffel tower.  Depending on the weather the balloon climbs up to either 150 or 300 meters. In either case, it's well worth the experience.
